intro: Senecio hindsii, commonly known as Hinds' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads. Senecio hindsii is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
